Reviews.Title: “Melita House Hotel review”
Reviews.Author: buyan_12
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this small London Hotel for one night over a weekend recently March 2012. There was three of us sharing a room. The hotel would not take the card I booked the hotel with from last minute web site. I had to pay fort he hotel on another card which I did not want to do. The room we had was very small if fact it was difficult to get around the beds. There was no tea or coffee making facilities in the room although when we asked for them we were given them. The shower door let all the water out of the shower unit so before we could shower we had to mop up the water on the floor. As the room was quiet wrm we wanted to open the windows to let in fresh air, however the window handels were broken and we had a hard time opening and closing them. The light screen to one of the lights above the bed was missing and the bright light was very bright indeed. The staff were friendly enough, but we were told that drinks were served by a drinks machine in the dining area which had to be paid for. The breakfasts was on the whole reasonable, but the portions were mean! and the full English breakfast had no mushrooms or tomatoes and the beans were served in a tiny pot. speaking of tiny, the orange squash was served in a sherry glass so one gulp and its was gone. Whilst I understand the need for profit it must not undermine the pleasure of the guests stay. There was no over night porter or staff at the hotel and the lounge area, a small room off the main corridor, was locked up at night so don`t expect any socialisation after dark. If you have a serious disability then you will be very disappointed by the stairs of which there were many and access to the building was not accessible to wheelchair or people with mobility issues.

Reviews.Title: “No room for the cat”
Reviews.Author: tonycStavanger
Reviews.Content: I have just finished reading an earlier review by Redwards81 of this hotel and completely agree with his comments. He wrote that you could not have swung a cat in the room. I say that there was not room for the cat. With my wife and I and two suitcases in the room, it was absolutely full. My specific comments were: - It was not big enough for a double bed. - The room was too hot but with the window open, the wind caused the window to rattle. I had to stuff paper between the two parts of the window to keep it quiet. - There was no soap in the shower soap dispenser. - Sitting on the toilet was very uncomfortable as my knee waqs pressing up against the shower. - The towels had seen better days. - Breakfast was a joke. The orange juice was served in a shot glass. One liitle swig and it was gone. - The food was either toast/preserves or cooked. Somehow they found a container for the baked beans which was even smaller than the orange juice glass. - We were the last ones down to brekfast so they started cleaning the other tables while we were still eating. The smell of detergent, mixed with the smell of food, was very unpleasant. - The nearest car park was 5-10 minutes walk away. For all of these pleasures, we paid £125 on checking in. We should not put up with this poor quality and poor value for money. I know it is central London but..........

Reviews.Title: “No room to swing a cat”
Reviews.Author: Redwards81
Reviews.Content: Had I taken a larger suitcase I would have been in trouble, because the room I was in was so so small. If you suffer from claustrophobia, stay away from this one. Even when I sat on the loo I was hard pressed against the radiator. Had it been on there would have been problems. Although the receptionist was pleasant enough, the experience as a whole was dire. Breakfast time is between 07:30 and 10:00. I went down at 08:30, and it was clear the breakfast had been cooked for 07:30 and simply kept luke warm. And they wouldn't even give me an extra rasher of bacon to replace the sausage I asked them to leave off my plate. The small pot of beans you get couldn't have had more than 20 beans in it - pathetic. And you only get a shot glass of orange juice. Very poor value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable!”
Reviews.Author: gph92
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night on business, booking a room on short notice in Wimbledon fortnight (Bad idea!). Make sure you make note of the postcode, as the taxi driver got lost twice trying to find this place! Room was quite small and incredibly room with only one desk fan provided. Asked for further ventilation, which unfortunately never arrived! Bathroom was well appointed, however shower seemed to be either very hot or very cold! Breakfast was ok, nothing particularly special. I personally thought it was a little expensive, but I suppose that's what you get for booking late eh!? Would visit again if in a similar situation, otherwise would try elsewhere first!

Reviews.Title: “3 Star Hotel that Actually Was!”
Reviews.Author: UkSwiss
Reviews.Content: Many London hotels say they are 3 star and when you get there they are really two with terrible service, and if you can find a english speaking person good luck. My room was very clean, and the breakfast service was excellent. Only 5 mins walk from Pimlico tube.

Reviews.Title: “Dissappointment”
Reviews.Author: ann w
Reviews.Content: There is only positive being the location. Too many negatives . We had five very uncomfortable nights. The beds were worn out, old and collapsed as were the pillows. Shower base filled up due to bad drainage. Reception attendant rude and unco-operative. I have never previously made complaints, however this complaint is necessary.

Reviews.Title: “Rated as 4* but not in this galaxy a desparate experience”
Reviews.Author: rogerwilson1
Reviews.Content: Very cramped no room to change dickensian view from our back room _ my wife was treated like an interloper on our arrival management very dismissive and unhelpful have stayed in better 2*. Never again

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: SabinaLaura
Reviews.Content: Three of us stayed here in the one room for four nights. Our first room was in the basement and it was quite cramped for three. We had left our window open a little the first night as it was warm and in the early hours of the morning a man put his head through but we jumped up and quickly shut the window and next morning reported the incident and asked to be moved. Reception were fantastic and very apologetic and moved us to a first floor room which was much larger and had a balcony. The rest of our stay was incident-free. Breakfast, served in a sunny dining room, is adequate. Small selection but hot breakfast was nice quality. All the staff were lovely, the rooms clean and the hotel is so convenient for Victoria rail and coach stations plus the many restaurants in the area. Just avoid a basement room facing the street.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel? I don't think so! B&B is a more apt description.”
Reviews.Author: sandyc1505
Reviews.Content: Staff friendly and helpful. That's about it! Had spent a very hot day watching tennis at Wimbledon. Was looking forward to shower....NO CHANCE. Couldn't adjust temp. Water was boiling. Would've been scalded if I hadn't tested the temp. before stepping into it. Breakfast was mediocre to say the least. Bacon or was it cardboard? Cold tinned tomato, dried up white sliced bread and a pathetic excuse of a sausage! Room was adequate for one night but certainly no longer.

Reviews.Title: “This is NOT a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Haemboy
Reviews.Content: There is no way I could describe this building as a hotel after staying there, one night was enough, more than enough! After having to juggle the cases up an extremely narrow staircase my husband and I were deposited outside a small, drab pokey room. There was no air-con, no tea/coffee. We were told we'd have to use the side door later on in the evening as the reception door was locked over night. There was a vending machine for tea/coffee but it was in the locked reception area so we couldn't even get a hot drink out of that. There was no staff on duty overnight and if a fire had broken out I shudder to think what could have been the outcome. This place can in no way be called a hotel, a proper B&B has the landlady/landlord on the premises this was a DUMP of a hostel how they get away with calling it a hotel I'll never know.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Palmier
Reviews.Content: I would recommend staying at this hotel. The customer service was excellent. I was staying at the hotel as I was doing the London Marathon. The man on reception was very kind and offered to do breakfast earlier than normal as I had to leave the hotel before. I thought this was great as I had previously stayed at a bigger hotel and they did not offer this kind of service. The room was a decent size and had everything you need for a nights stay. My only comment would be that there is no kettle to make a tea or coffee. The hotel is in a great location for restaurants which are only a short walk away with plenty of variety to choose from and also only a 5-10 min walk away from Victoria Station

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, we will stay in this hotel again !”
Reviews.Author: ctisserand
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Melita Hotel with my sister and two other friends in a room for 4 people. We were really glad to have chosen this hotel, it is really well situated, close to the Victoria Station, the place is lovely and in a quiet street, the staff is really kind, they did everything they could for us to have a pleasant stay. The room is very clean, fresh towels given every day, the room is cleaned and the beds made every day too, There's a hairddryer in the room, a safe, and a fridge too. As for breakfast, English or continental, very good ! We chose the "light option" which contained orange juice, cereal, toasted bread, marmelade, tea or coffee. The staff kindly accepted to keep our luggage on the check out day. Don't hesitate, go there ! We'll go back there for sure !!!! (and no, we weren't given any money to write such a good review !) Caroline, Lydie, Carine and Fiona.

Reviews.Title: “Very small rooms--may work for you”
Reviews.Author: Scooter_014
Reviews.Content: I stayed here December 2010 for three nights. Negatives: Not sure of the average size of hotel rooms in London, but this hotel's room was extremely small. My bathroom door would not even open all the way because the bed was in the way. I almost tripped over my suitcase when entering/exiting the room, because there was such limited floorspace. The old building has squeaky floors and rooms that were not soundproof--I was awakened every morning at about 7 am by the staff preparing breakfast. The room had a refridgerator, but it never got cold and smelled musty when open. Positives: Any questions I had were quickly and efficiently handled by the friendly staff. The breakfast was excellent, and cooked to order. The location is a pleasant 10 minute walk to the Tube stop. I didn't spend too much time in the hotel, because I was out exploring London. If you are only looking for a place to store your bags and sleep, Melita House may work for you. I noticed several other hotels in the same area that might have larger rooms...I would ask there before I stay at Melita House again.

Reviews.Title: “Most mildew I have ever seen; teeny tiny rooms and very noisy.”
Reviews.Author: originaltracy
Reviews.Content: Rooms: D-. Tiniest rooms I have ever seen, even by European standards; I am NOT usually picky about this, but there was actually not even enough room to open my suitcase on the floor and walk around at the same time. Floors are very creaky and the walls/ceilings/floors are super thin and transmit every step, cough, flush of the other toilets, etc. You need earplugs or don't plan on getting any rest. Bathroom: F-. My shower stall had more mildew and mold than I have ever seen in my life, I took photos to show the front desk. To be fair, my friend said his bathroom was clean, but both of my different rooms were moldy. The drain did not drain properly, so I ended up standing in the water while I tried to get clean. Breakfast: A. Traditional English breakfast or a smaller option of cereal, toast, etc. Food was delicious and included in the price. Service: A. The front desk employees were very nice, friendly and helpful. They moved me to another room when I complained, although it ended up just as bad, at least they tried. Location: A. About 6-7 min walk to Pimlico tube station. Access to everywhere from there. The street where it is located is very pretty and classy. Price: C. They charged me 89 pounds a night (almost $140) for a TINY (not exaggerating there was barely room to open my suitcase on the floor) room, the quality of which was ridiculously awful. By London standards, I suppose that sounds cheap, but not for what you get. My experience: First room had EXTREME mold in shower and very noisy water pump room right outside my door, which kept me up the first 2 nights. They promised to turn it off after the first night, which they didn't do or forgot to do. Third night I was moved upstairs, but the next room also had mildew in the grout, and the drain once again did not drain, so I was showering in standing water (gross!). Then my heat went out in the middle of the night; I was forced to get out of bed and go downstairs to find someone to turn that "pump" back on so that the hot water would go up to my radiator. Why would they turn a pump off (even if it is noisy), if it provides heat to the rooms? After all the filth, trouble, and complaining, and even after I showed them my mold photos, they did not even offer me a discount or a free night or anything. Also, I wish they would include the WIFI with the price instead of charging 10 pounds per night. Kind of a turn-off. Even with some good features (breakfast, location, front desk staff), the lack of sleep on a very busy vacation and the dirtiness and size of the rooms was enough to ruin the whole trip. The front desk staff tried their best to accommodate me, but there was really nothing more they could do; I do appreciate their efforts. Unfortunate.

Reviews.Title: “Do yourself and your wallet a a favour BOOK ELSEWHERE!”
Reviews.Author: GlobeExplorer4Life
Reviews.Content: By far one of the WORST places that we have ever stayed. The Old beds are extremely uncomfotable. The rooms are Very small where everything is crammed. We struggled finding space for our luggage. Water pressure is mediocre, No soap. instead, you have the same liquid soap filled in the shampoo & soap container with NO small towel to use when showering. The included "Enlglish Breakfast" is mediocre (To put it politely, the food quality is extreamly cheap!). The common areas such as the corredors get filled with burned bacon smell every morning as the kitchen is poorly ventaled. Our 2nd floor room was filled with burning beacon as of 7am during our 4 day-stay. BEWARE of the "Agreement" that holds you hostage to this property. In our country (Canada), this type of agreement is illegal and owners are prosecuted and fined by Consumer Protection Agencies! The staff is nice but have language barrier (poor english). In short, you CAN find MUCH Better Value for your money staying at Holiday In Express and Best Western (within 2 minutes walking distance) than staying at Melita House. If we could have gotten out of the "Binding contract", we would have checked out the next day!

Reviews.Title: “If TA offered less than ratings, I'd use them for this hotel”
Reviews.Author: ElleF63
Reviews.Content: We arrived mid-afternoon, on a particularly cold, grey day. The heating was not on, and the room was freezing. We asked, and were told that the heat comes on at 5. Our room was tiny, there was a draught blowing a gale through the doors to the patio, and there was a big stain on the bed spread â€“ yuck! Although I knew this was an inexpensive hotel, I hadn't anticipated cheap. Internet access for four days cost me Â£35, and was patchy, at best. The full english breakfast, included in the price, wasn't worth eating â€“ weak orange squash instead of fresh orange juice? Requests to speak to the manager were largely ignored â€“ he's not here now, he just left, he'll be back in half an hour â€“ until on our last day I was told to write a list of complaints in a letter. The 5% surcharge on credit card transactions was enough to make me pay cash, which of course means any complaints wont be heard. Pretty disappointing, to say the least.

Reviews.Title: “Do you want sleep on the U ?”
Reviews.Author: Xaranda
Reviews.Content: Do you want sleep on the U ? I booked directly with Melita â€œâ€¦.for the best guaranteed dealâ€� , and the prize that we received was one substandard room in the underground with dirty patio views, where they store cigarette ends and rubbish. They donâ€™t advice in its site www.melitahotel.com that there are many rooms in the underground, they only shows their standard rooms and its misleading web site and after they placed you into unhealthy substandard rooms

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it”
Reviews.Author: wren47
Reviews.Content: I checked in and checked out within three hours. I am no princess and this hotel was by far the worst hotel I have ever booked. The bed linens were soiled with stains and animal hair. The carpet looked like it has never seen the business end of a vacuum. The room was so tiny we could barely fit our bags let alone ourselves in the room. If you have heavy luggage, good luck getting up the stairs, they are narrow as all get out. There was no safe in the room as promised and the door to the room was flimsy at best. If you want to hear what your neighbors are doing, you can. Read the cancellation policy beforehand. They claim they will "re-let" the room if you cancel, but they don't. I want my money back. Worst hotel experience ever.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: CBSanford
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, and my sister and her husband, stayed at Melita for a week. Our first bedroom was very small, but livable, so we didn't complain. A couple of days later, desk clerk Ingomar told my wife and me a larger room would be available the next day, and even moved our luggage for us since we were going to be out on an all-day tour. The room's refrigerator only slightly cooled, so Maria, the other desk clerk, let us store our cold cuts and cheeses in the hotel refrigerator; they also let the four of us use the dining room each evening for wine and sometimes our bread-and-meat-and-cheese supper. When I came down with a persistent cough, the manager, Robert, gave us detailed directions on finding a nearby walk-in medical office. When a shower suddenly would put out nothing but super-hot water, the staff got it fixed within the hour. The staff also gladly offered excellent advice and directions on getting around London. The free English breakfast was was adequate and satisfactory but monotonous: it always consisted of a fried egg, a whole stewed tomato, a piece of "bacon" (more like Canadian bacon or ham), a bland meal-filled sausage, and two pieces of toast, with butter and marmalade. Some alternatives were offered: poached or very bland scrambled eggs, for instance. (But a more interesting breakfast elsewhere would have cost probably close to ten pounds.) Summary: Hotel: An excellent value. Location: Convenient (15-min walk or 10-minute bus ride to Victoria Station; Pimlico tube station even closer) Room: Simple but completely satisfactory. Breakfasts: Adequate but dull. Staff: Wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: WLondon77
Reviews.Content: Ended up here because we live round the corner from here - plumbers cut off our water supply...which we discovered when we got home at 9.45 and then had to find a hotel with a spare room for the night! Anyway - onto the review. It's not super deluxe, but our room was a reasonable size, the bed was comfy, the shower was good and most importantly the whole room and bathroom were spotlessly clean. Breakfast was good and everyone working there seemed friendly and helpful. The only negative thing I can find to say is that I think it's a touch over priced. Apart from that - big thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: GaiC
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Melita house in Jun which was my first trip to London so I dont have a comparison. The hotel was very clean, it was very well located only a short walk to Victoria station. The WIFI didnt work on my phone but they did try really hard to sort that out. The room I had was very very small. I have 2 more trips to London over the next few weeks so I will try other hotels for a compairson.

Reviews.Title: “Not luxurious, but cozy and with a great staff”
Reviews.Author: Frizero
Reviews.Content: We had many problems in finding a decent hotel in London which had a great location, were clean, comfortable and not quite expensive. We finally decided to book two rooms at Melita House Hotel and it was the best thing we could do considering our budget. We stayed there 18 days and stayed in three different rooms in the whole period. The hotel is in a peaceful, charming and silent street at Pimlico, a pretty nice neighborhood in London, quite near to Victoria Station and a walking distance from major touristic attractions such as the Buckingham palace, the Westminster Abbey and the Westminster Catholic Cathedral, as well as Tate Britain and shows such as 'Billy Elliot' and 'Wicked'. Besides, buying an Oyster pass you will virtually be anywhere, since Bus line 24 passes by the hotel and it taks you to Trafalgar Square, British Museum, Buckingham Palace and Victoria Station, just to mention a few places. we had no problems at all to take places from the hotel. The rooms are not very big - but I have seen smaller ones and, well, who cares to that when you have the whole London to visit all day long? Positive: the rooms are quite clean and comfortable, decoration is OK and we had no problems in any of the rooms . Breakfast is delicious but there isn't many options: English breakfast (egg, bacon, sausage, tomato, toasts, orange juice, coffee, milk, tea, preserves) or scrambled eggs (and other variations), or cereals. My mother-in-law and I ate the English breaskfast for 18 days and we loved it. My wife doesn't eat pork and had some problems - but we bought some fruit in a local market and everything went well. Oh, yes, there are many restaurants, supermarkets, charming stores and tea houses in the neighborhood. But the real reason for me to give a high punctuation to Melita House Hotel is the staff: they were simply amazing, always helpful, always friendly, specially with my mother-in-law, who doesn't speak English. One negative aspect: forget Internet - very expensive in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate but not luxurious.”
Reviews.Author: HLHotel
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel was pleasent, a nice building in a quiet location with friendly staff. However, the carpet in the room was in need of a good vacuum, yet the bathroom, though very small, had good new taps and soap dispensors, (plus a few nasty hairs in the shower!). The room was also small, and lacked the all important tea set! The new flat screen television was pleasing, yet watching it on the old duvan matresses wasn't great. They could do with replacement. The room was a very suitable base for sightseeing, with low prices, it did work out good value for money, espically in comparison to other London hotels. The decoration of the rooms was dated yet fine, the colour scheme was consistent. Breakfast, which is included in the room price, was well cooked yet very small! One sausage, bacon, egg and a tinned tomato, served with toast and orange squash not juice as stated! The staff, who were mostly Polish, we're polite and friendly. I would recommend the hotel to someone in search of a well priced hotel, as a base for business or sightseeing, yet if you intend on a luxurious visit, the hotel is most likely not for you!

Reviews.Title: “Small Hot Room”
Reviews.Author: naplesguy
Reviews.Content: The room I stayed in was in the back of the hotel. There was no A/C. Because the window was in the back of the hotel there was no breeze. Even the nights were hot because of this. Otherwise the room was ok. It was small, but I understand that this is normal for london. There was good cable tv and the rooms were cleaned everyday although the sheets weren't changed. The sheets had stains on them. The hotel was quiet. I wouldn't stay there again or recommend it to friends. I found the breakfast to be pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “An enjoyable break”
Reviews.Author: Welshies4
Reviews.Content: We were checked in and shown to our room before our check in time of 12pm. We booked the triple room which had a double and single bed. Really clean and comfortable. Bathroom with toilet, sink and shower. Breakfast was good. The location was quiet and ten minutes walk from Victoria Station. Bus stop and taxi were available just down the road. All staff were polite and helpful. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Only OK”
Reviews.Author: mackq
Reviews.Content: Very Basic and Pokey. Very little English spoken Room was small, Breakfast only ok, Tea awful. Would not re visit. Location good and neighbourhood is nice very close to Victoria station.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: europhileAustralia
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights to use as a base for London. Room up narrow staicase with fire doors to negotiate made luggage carrying difficult-3 flights of steep stairs and no lift! Room cramped but OK and clean.Noisy overhead neighbours did not help sleep. Breakfast appalling with vacuum flask tea and coffee and synthetic orange cordial masquerading as juice. Poor quality white bread and perfunctory service made breakfast a negative experience. Position convenient and fortunately a decent coffeeshp near Pimlico underground station with internet saved our sanity.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: oshtraveller
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this hotel was the location to tube stations and reasonable walking distance to tourist sites. The rooms were very small. The walls were paper thin and we heard everything. Our shower would stop flowing mid shower. The toilet took 3-5 attempts to get it to flush. The breakfast was less than desireable (powdered orange juice and stale coffee). Charged 2 lbs. for 2 local phone calls. 5% surcharge to pay with credit card. I wish we had spent a little more and stayed somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Gunther1
Reviews.Content: Me and my family stayed at Melita for 3 nights. We arrived about 10 AM. The check-in starts at 12.00, so we just wanted to drop our luggage and come back later, but they were very kind and prepared the room for us in 15 minutes, so we checked-in straight away! We had a room on the first floor and it was facing the street. Although the hotel is very close to the Victoria and Pimlico Station and getting to the centre is a matter of few minutes, the hotel itself is located on a quiet side road, so we enjoyed our sleep. The staff was very nice and helpful and we would like to say a big Thank You to the very nice man in Reception and to the owner, who managed to get us tickets for a day tour on the same day in the morning, even though the tour operator said the tour was already fully booked! We enjoyed the breakfast, especially the english breakfast option was a real delight. We were staying in a few Hotels in London over the past 3 years, especially me during my bussines trips, but I've never seen a hotel so clean! So again, big thanks to the housekeeping. Overall it was a very pleasant experience and we will return!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Karins_travels
Reviews.Content: This hotel is too expensive for what you get. They promised us a quiet room - we got one where the windows could not be shut properly and therefore heard the traffic noise all night. (The hotel is adjacent a main street with traffick at all times.) The rooms are also not sound proofed, we heard the man next door snore! and in the morning the flushing of toilets etc from the rooms above, below and next doors. It sounded almost like we lived in the plumbing! There was not enough water pressure for showers in the morning (we stayed on second floor). After remarking on this they put on an extra pump, but then evidently turned it off again since this happened again. Breakfast was scant - the orange juice was syrup, not juice, and the eggs were overdone. All of this I think I could put up with - at another price - but at the current price - it is simply not worth the money and therefore a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “A great smaller hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tamnade
Reviews.Content: This hotel gave value for money .The staff were extremely helpful . The room we stayed in was comfortable spacious and quiet. Breakfast was good. Nice to be waited on !

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive for too little”
Reviews.Author: MiaL
Reviews.Content: Good location and breakfast. Rooms are a small and a bit shabby, though. 100 pounds per night is a bit excessive in my opinion. There are several B&Bs in this area that I will check for lower rates next time. Hotel owner was very friendly, though.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms but great value”
Reviews.Author: scorpiodawgs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Melita House hotel after looking through TripAdvisor for hotels in our price range that did not have reviews referring to rats in the ceiling :-) We were pleasantly surprised by this business. Pros: - Courteous staff - Decent breakfast - Password-protected safe available in the closet - Very clean room/bathroom - Good location (only a quick bus/subway ride to Trafalgar square and a 20 minute walk to the "London eye") Cons: - Room just about big enough for a couple - No A/C, just a table fan (which was sufficient though, to be fair) We would recommend this hotel wholeheartedly - in fact we stayed there for one more day on our way back and got a slightly bigger room.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: columbiasc
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in a quad room in the basement during the heat wave in July. The room was much bigger than I expected and very quiet. (The bathroom was almost as large as a some hotel rooms!) The beds were comfortable, and it was great to have a refrigerator. The staff was friendly, and helped us get my mother's bag down the narrow stairs. We really enjoyed the location near Victoria Station. It's definitely budget, and so there was no A/C, and the breakfast was as others here describe -- the orange juice tastes synthetic, the English breakfast is VERY greasy, and so we just had cereal, toast and tea. To us these were fairly minor issues, since we paid only about $70 per person per night which seemed like a really good deal for London! We would certainly consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay near attractions”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The rooms have been renovated and were nice. Flat screen tv in the lounge area. Location is within ten minutes to two stations. See more photos and a review at Southpoint.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Disappointing Room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights and had booked here based on reviews using terms like "little gem," etc. This set us up for a great disappointment. Don't get me wrong--the location is fine, Robert the proprietor is very affable, the staff is helpful and well-intentioned, but it's really tough to pay over $200 a night for a tiny, faded room with a cramped bathroom whose sink and shower don't drain properly, and where the headboards of the beds are literally boards screwed into the wall to save space. The breakfast beverage you assume should be orange juice is actually made from some synthetic-tasting substitute. This kind of pointless cost-cutting just underscores the feeling that you're not getting value for the money. For anyone living on the U.S. east coast, the best way to put it is that if you paid over $50 a night for this setup you would feel ripped off. Since it's London, factor in what you think London is worth. One hundred percent more? OK, then it's $100 too expensive. Lest you think I'm too picky: When we moved on to Edinburgh, for the SAME price we had a beautifuly decorated, two-bedroom, two-bathroom apartment with 12-foot ceilings, granite-countered kitchen, TV and stereo, complimentary breakfast snacks and wine in the evenings, etc., in a great neighborhood. We will be very careful before selecting London accommodations in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Below average but clean”
Reviews.Author: VickyLondon
Reviews.Content: For Â£95 for a double room, they seemed pretty much on the small side. We were shown to the top storey room but the shower thermostat wasn't working so we were given a basement room instead. The room was very clean as was the bathroom. The shower was powerful. The plug in the sink, however, was stuck. All in all didn't really impress me but cleanliness in London hotels is hard to come by!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Family Run Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband & I spent 8 nights at this lovely little hotel & we enjoyed it very much. Room was a little small & the bathroom was tiny, but this was our only concern. The hotel was in a great location, very clean, rooms serviced daily, breakfast fabulous & all hotel staff very friendly & very helpful - nothing was too much trouble for them. We were 5 minutes walk from Victoria Station, excellent restaurants & shopping & a number 24 bus just around the corner which took us to most places we wanted to go, or connected easily with other bus routes. We would happily go back & stay there again. We asked for a room that would be quiet late at night & that is what we got. Could not speak highly enough of this hotel & all the staff - a great hotel at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Easy to Find”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely sunny room at the front of the hotel with a fascinating window box of geraniums! Despite being on the ground floor and just a couple of buildings away from Belgrave Road there was no there was no noise from traffic. Bed linen looked a little jaded but was clean. Furniture a little tacky and decor a little shoddy but at that price can't complain. Bathroom clean and shower good. Loved the location. Walked to and from Westminster early eveing once crowds had gone home - fabulous! Breakfast basic but very pleasnt dining room.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: linstustulin
Reviews.Content: Could not complain about this accomodation at the bargain price. The rooms were comfortable and clean and it is in an excellent location near most major attractions. The number 24 bus stops around the corner and takes you to many of the tourist sights and for Â£3 per day it was a bargain. The staff at the hotel were extremely friendly and helpful. The breakfast was not fantastic but again value for money. Some noise from the plumbing but none from the traffic at night as it is situated on a side road.

HotelInfo.Name: Melita House Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 35 Charlwood Street, Victoria, London SW1V 2DU, England
